title: 'See you in the next life': Johnny Vegas sparks concerns among fans with cryptic message
text:
Johnny Vegas sparked concern among fans on Tuesday evening when he shared a cryptic message on Twitter.

The funnyman, 49, took to the microblogging site, on which he boasts 387,800 followers, to pen: 'See you in the next life x Night all', leading to a widespread reaction from fearful fans who soon sent messages of support.

Worries were swiftly quashed however when one of his knowledgeable followers divulged that the quote was from 1988 movie Midnight Run, shortly before Johnny confirmed the fact and apologised for causing concern.

Shocking: Johnny Vegas sparked concern among fans on Tuesday evening when he shared a cryptic message on Twitter

Hurtful: The funnyman, 49, took to the microblogging site, on which he boasts 387,800 followers, to pen: 'See you in the next life x Night all'

Johnny, real name Michael Pennington, took to Twitter to share the quote from Charles Grodin's character Jonathan Mardukas.

Worried fans soon responded saying: 'Was just going to bed. Now I’m probably not going to get a wink worrying about what this means...

'Oi! You have unfinished work here... How to panic the whole country in one tweet... Wtf? Johnny, what's going on?... You okay, mate?... Woah... good morning! Can someone give him a poke please?'

In a more extreme concern, one user wrote: 'ffs I thought it was a 2am suicide note and was about to call 101 when I saw your tweet. S**t! :D'.

Having noted the furore, Johnny wrote: 'I’m absolutely fine. Apologies to anyone who hadn’t read my earlier twitter thread, I was merely quoting the end of a favourite movie ‘Midnight Run’ Sorry if it lead to unnecessary concern, all grand here X'.

Away from his Twitter activity, Johnny hit headlines when he unveiled his dramatic weight loss in the summer of 2018, when he shared an unrecognisable snap on the site, in which he displayed a newly slender physique.

Concern: Fans were left worried by the message yet he soon quashed their fears

In the summer of last year, the erstwhile Benidorm star said during an interview on Loose Women that he has 'not been on a diet' and instead 'changed his lifestyle'.

He said: 'I am very careful about coming on and celebrating weight loss because it makes other people feel bad.

'I have not done a diet in anyway whatsoever. I have cut out things, it’s a lifestyle change. Then you can live with it and you don’t feel like you are denying yourself anything - apart from cheese!'
